title: Federer to play exhibition duel against Zverev in Chile
text:
Team Europe's Roger Federer kisses the trophy after they win the Laver Cup in Palexpo, Geneva, Switzerland, September 22, 2019. [Photo/Agencies]

SANTIAGO - Swiss tennis legend Roger Federer will meet Germany's Alexander Zverev in an exhibition duel in Chile next month as part of a Latin American tour that also includes stops in Colombia, Argentina, Ecuador and Mexico.

The clash will be played at the 12,600-seat Movistar Arena in Santiago on November 19, organizers said on Monday.

"Hi Chile. I can't wait to play in Santiago against my good friend Alexander Zverev. See you."

Ticket prices for the match will range from 104 to 280 U.S. dollars.

Federer, whose 20 grand slam titles make him the most successful male player in tennis history, is currently third in the ATP tour rankings while Zverev is sixth.
